extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect(java.lang.String address)
        Tries to establish connection with a waiting remote Socket on the passed address
        Parameters:
        address - to be connected to
        Returns:
        true if the connection was successfully established, false otherwise

      • send

        public void send(byte[] message)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to send the passed message through the current connection

        Sends the message to the remote peer. Doesn't check if the message has been actually received.

        Parameters:
        message - to be sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of socket errors

      • receiveMessage

        public byte[] receiveMessage()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Receives a message from the currently connected Socket.

        Blocks the current Thread until a message is received or an Exception occurs.

        Returns:
        array of byte message if the read operation succeeded, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of socket errors

      • startServer

        public boolean startServer()
        Starts listening to incoming connections

        Blocks the current Thread until a successful connection has been established or an Exception occurred.

        Returns:
        true once a connection has been established, false in case of Exception

      • setServerMode

        public void setServerMode()
        Closes the currently connected socket and sets the status of the program to SERVERMODE

      • setClientMode

        public void setClientMode()
        Closes the currently connected socket and sets the status of the program to CLIENTMODE

      • closeCurrentSocket

        public void closeCurrentSocket()
        Closes the currently open Socket.

      • closeServerSocket

        public void closeServerSocket()
        Closes the current ServerSocket.

        Unblocks the corresponding Thread

      • getPartnerAddress

        public java.lang.String getPartnerAddress()
        Returns:
        InetAddress of the currently connected peer as String, null if the socket doesn't exist.

      • getSocketStatus

        public SocketStatus getSocketStatus()
        Returns:
        the SocketStatus of the current Socket
